# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Sure, here is the solution for your problem.

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10) 
    words = split(input_str, " ")   # split input string into array of words
    result = ""                      # initialize resultant string

    for word in words  
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"           # add newline character 
        end
        result *= word               # append the current word to the result
        result *= " "                # add a space after each word
    end
    
    return strip(result)             # remove leading/trailing whitespaces
end
```

Here is an example of how you could use this function:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test string", text_width=20))
```

Output:

```
This is a test 
string
```
